items.preText: Thisara hasn't been too good so far, bowling two lengths.
items.text: but he strikes ... Mushfiqur has something to say to Sabbir. That was an awful stroke at 57 for 4. A full delivery on middle and leg, the ball moves back in slightly, Sabbir runs down at the bowler and looks to smash him over mid-on but that inward movement takes it off the inside half and lobs to mid-on. What a chance for Sabbir, he has thrown it away.
items.shortText: Perera to Sabbir Rahman, OUT

athlete.name: Lakshan Sandakan
athlete.fullName: Paththamperuma Arachchige Don Lakshan Rangika Sandakan

dismissal.text: Sabbir Rahman c sub (DSK Madushanka) b Perera 10 (12b 2x4 0x6) SR: 83.33

items.preText: Abul Hasan. A wide slip. A leg gully.
items.text: short and wide outside off, 125 kph, left alone. Why are Sri Lanka targetting new batsmen with short balls? Surely, the better option is to go full and open more options. And go short if it doesn't work?
items.shortText: Perera to Abul Hasan, no run

athlete.name: Lakshan Sandakan

items.text: two more, leg byes. Flat delivery outside off, the ball spins back in. Rahim, it seems, has got outside the line, but the ball rolls away towards fine leg for a couple of leg byes. Chandimal wants to review though. Doesn't look like there is bat, it spun back and hit him on the front leg in front of off. Was there too much turn? Actually, UltraEdge has a spike as it's passing the inside edge, so leg byes may have to be changed to runs.
items.shortText: Sandakan to Mushfiqur Rahim, 2 runs

items.text: wow, that's a well-directed bouncer, on middle. Climbs steeply on the batsman who plays it down somehow. Very awkward fend

items.text: 127 kph, short and wide again, Abul goes after it, and gets a toe-end on the shot, races away past slip for four.
items.shortText: Perera to Abul Hasan, FOUR runs

athlete.name: Lakshan Sandakan
athlete.fullName: Paththamperuma Arachchige Don Lakshan Rangika Sandakan

items.text: 128 kph and taken! So Sri Lanka continue to strike, but Abul Hasan reviews after speaking to Mushfiqur. He should have known. It's a full delivery outside off, the ball comes back in, takes the inside edge and carries through to Dickwella, who dives away to his right. That's an appalling review, you only get one in ODIs, and Mushfiqur or any other batsman can't review now if they get a shocker. A big spike on UltraEdge.
items.shortText: Perera to Abul Hasan, OUT

athlete.name: Lakshan Sandakan
athlete.fullName: Paththamperuma Arachchige Don Lakshan Rangika Sandakan

dismissal.text: Abul Hasan c †Dickwella b Perera 7 (7b 1x4 0x6) SR: 100.00
